cards.name: Phyrexian War Beast
cards.text: When Phyrexian War Beast leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a land and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Deal with the spawn of Phyrexia cautiously; only with time may we control them."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist
cards.originalText: If Phyrexian War Beast leaves play, sacrifice a land, and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Phyrexian War Beast
cards.text: When Phyrexian War Beast leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a land and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Knowing its origins, how could they have thought they could control it?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic
cards.originalText: If Phyrexian War Beast leaves play, sacrifice a land, and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Scarab of the Unseen
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Scarab of the Unseen: Return all Auras attached to target permanent you own to their owners' hands. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice Scarab of the Unseen to return all enchantments on target permanent you own to their owners' hand. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Shield Sphere
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Shield Sphere blocks, put a -0/-1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"My Soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor
cards.originalText:
Counts as a wall
If Shield Sphere is assigned as a blocker, put a -0/-1 counter on it.

cards.name: Sol Grail
cards.text:
As Sol Grail enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
cards.flavor: "Look deep into the Grail, and see there what you desire most." —Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen
cards.originalText:
When Sol Grail comes into play, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Soldevi Digger
cards.text: {2}: Put the top card of your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor:
"This ceaseless device has helped uncover marvels unreachable by mere flesh."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist
cards.originalText: {2}: Put the top card of your graveyard on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Soldevi Sentry
cards.text: {1}: Choose target opponent. Regenerate Soldevi Sentry. When it regenerates this way, that player may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Our newfound security enables us to turn more of our attentions to the wonders that lie deep within the soil."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist
cards.originalText: {1}: Regenerate. Target opponent may draw a card.

cards.name: Soldevi Sentry
cards.text: {1}: Choose target opponent. Regenerate Soldevi Sentry. When it regenerates this way, that player may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"A dreadful invention. What ease is there under the watchful eye of cold steel?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic
cards.originalText: {1}: Regenerate. Target opponent may draw a card.

Whenever Soldevi Steam Beast becomes tapped, target opponent gains 2 life.

cards.name: Storm Cauldron
cards.text:
Each player may play an additional land during each of their turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If a land is tapped for mana and sacrificed all in one action, it goes to the graveyard before the Cauldron can return it to the player's hand.
If a land is tapped for mana, it is returned to its owner's hand as a triggered ability.
Having multiples of these on the battlefield means you can play an additional land for each one.

cards.originalText:
During each player's turn, that player may put one additional land into play.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return that land to owner's hand.

cards.name: Urza's Engine
cards.text:
Trample
{3}: Urza's Engine gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
{3}: Attacking creatures banded with Urza's Engine gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Humans and machines working together can be fearsome indeed!" —Arcum Dagsson

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText:
Trample
{3}: Banding until end of turn
{3}: All creatures banded with Urza's Engine gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Whirling Catapult
cards.text: {2}, Exile the top two cards of your library: Whirling Catapult deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Direct confrontation never was to the Orcs' taste."
—General Varchild

rulings.text: If your library has fewer than two cards in it, you can't activate the ability.

cards.originalText: {2}: Remove the top two cards of your library from the game to have Whirling Catapult deal 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Balduvian Dead
cards.text: {2}{R}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 3/1 black and red Graveborn creature token with haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the ability is activated during a turn's Ending phase (after any "at the beginning of the End step" triggers would have triggered that turn), the Graveborn token will remain on the battlefield until the following turn's End step.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}: Remove target summon card in your graveyard from the game to put a Graveborn token into play. Treat this token as a 3/1 black and red creature that can attack the turn it comes into play. Bury Graveborn token at end of turn.

cards.name: Casting of Bones
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, draw three cards, then discard one of them.
cards.flavor:
"Only a necromancer would create such a foul form of divination."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen
cards.originalText: If enchanted creature is put into the graveyard, draw three cards. Choose and discard one of those cards.

cards.name: Casting of Bones
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, draw three cards, then discard one of them.
cards.flavor:
"Whether whole or not, still we serve Lim-Dûl's wishes."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn
cards.originalText: If enchanted creature is put into the graveyard, draw three cards. Choose and discard one of those cards.

cards.name: Contagion
cards.text:
You may pay 1 life and exile a black card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Distribute two -2/-1 counters among one or two target creatures.
cards.originalText: You may pay 1 life and remove a black card in your hand from the game instead of paying Contagion's casting cost. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life. Put two -2/-1 counters, distributed any way you choose, on any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Diseased Vermin
cards.text:
Whenever Diseased Vermin deals combat damage to a player, put an infection counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, Diseased Vermin deals X damage to target opponent previously dealt damage by it, where X is the number of infection counters on it.
cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, Diseased Vermin deals 1 damage to a single target opponent it has previously damaged for each infection counter on Diseased Vermin.
If Diseased Vermin damages a player in combat, put an infection counter on it.

cards.name: Dystopia
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a green or white permanent.

rulings.text: The permanent is chosen and sacrificed during resolution.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative Upkeep: 1 life
During each player's upkeep, if that player controls any green or white permanents, he or she sacrifices a green or white permanent.

cards.name: Fatal Lore
cards.text:
An opponent chooses one —
• You draw three cards.
• You destroy up to two target creatures that player controls. They can't be regenerated. That player draws up to three cards.
cards.flavor:
"All knowledge has its price."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

rulings.text: The opponent chooses which option they want (this is a mode choice). If they choose the "destroy" option, you choose the zero, one, or two targets after that.

cards.originalText: Target opponent chooses one: you draw three cards; or you choose and bury up to two target creatures that opponent controls and he or she draws up to three cards.

cards.name: Feast or Famine
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
• Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The living cannot understand the benefits of death."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn
cards.originalText: Bury target non-black, non-artifact creature or put a Zombie token into play. Treat this token as a 2/2 black creature.

cards.name: Feast or Famine
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
• Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"We are not yet free of Lim-Dûl's terrors."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest
cards.originalText: Bury target non-black, non-artifact creature or put a Zombie token into play. Treat this token as a 2/2 black creature.

Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Insidious Bookworms
cards.text: When Insidious Bookworms dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, target player discards a card at random.
cards.originalText: {1}{B}: Target player discards a card at random from his or her hand. Use this ability only when Insidious Bookworms is put into the graveyard from play. You cannot spend more than {1}{B} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Insidious Bookworms
cards.text: When Insidious Bookworms dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, target player discards a card at random.
cards.originalText: {1}{B}: Target player discards a card at random from his or her hand. Use this ability only when Insidious Bookworms is put into the graveyard from play. You cannot spend more than {1}{B} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Keeper of Tresserhorn
cards.text: Whenever Keeper of Tresserhorn attacks and isn't blocked, it assigns no combat damage this turn and defending player loses 2 life.

rulings.text: The ability triggers on declaration of blockers if the criteria is met.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Keeper of Tresserhorn attacks and is not blocked, it deals no damage to defending player this turn and that player loses 2 life. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Krovikan Horror
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if Krovikan Horror is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may return Krovikan Horror to your hand.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Krovikan Horror deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
At the end of any turn, if Krovikan Horror is in your graveyard with a summon card directly above it, you may put Krovikan Horror into your hand.
{1}: Sacrifice a creature to have Krovikan Horror deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Krovikan Plague
cards.text:
Enchant non-Wall creature you control
When Krovikan Plague enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Tap enchanted creature: Krovikan Plague deals 1 damage to any target. Put a -0/-1 counter on enchanted creature. Activate this ability only if enchanted creature is untapped.

rulings.text: The Aura will be put into the graveyard if you lose control of the creature or if it somehow becomes a Wall.

cards.originalText:
Play on a non-wall creature you control.
Draw a card at the beginning of the upkeep of the turn after Krovikan Plague comes into play.
{0}: Tap enchanted creature to have Krovikan Plague deal 1 damage to target creature or player. Put a -0/-1 counter on enchanted creature.

cards.name: Misinformation
cards.text: Put up to three target cards from an opponent's graveyard on top of their library in any order.
cards.flavor: "When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts." —Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

rulings.text: You target the cards, but not the opponent.
You don't need to show the opponent what order you put the cards on top of their library.

cards.originalText: Put up to three target cards from an opponent's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order.

cards.name: Phantasmal Fiend
cards.text:
{B}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn.

rulings.text: Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.

Effects that switch power and toughness are always applied last when determining a creature's power and toughness, even if other power/toughness-changing effects are created later in the turn. For example, if you activate Phantasmal Fiend's first ability, it will become 2/4. Then if you activate its second ability, it will become 4/2. Then if you activate its first ability again, it will become 3/3.
Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.originalText:
{B}: +1/-1 until end of turn
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn. Effects that alter Phantasmal Fiend's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa.

Enchant creature

cards.name: Ritual of the Machine
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
cards.flavor:
"Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson heed the danger therein?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature to gain control of target non-black, non-artifact creature.

cards.name: Soldevi Adnate
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a black or artifact creature: Add an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"People love to follow fools; they don't feel so alone then."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice a black or artifact creature to add an amount of {B} equal to that creature's casting cost to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Soldevi Adnate
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a black or artifact creature: Add an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"An idiot cannot hear sense, even when a thousand people speak it."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice a black or artifact creature to add an amount of {B} equal to that creature's casting cost to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Stench of Decay
cards.text: Nonartifact creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"My lord, there is only so much I can do. This plague infests Krov worse than any other city."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest
cards.originalText: All non-artifact creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Stench of Decay
cards.text: Nonartifact creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Disa is dead, and I am left. I shall allow no others to succumb to this pestilence."
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid
cards.originalText: All non-artifact creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Stromgald Spy
cards.text: Whenever Stromgald Spy attacks and isn't blocked, you may have defending player play with their hand revealed for as long as Stromgald Spy remains on the battlefield. If you do, Stromgald Spy assigns no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Stromgald Spy attacks and is not blocked, you may choose to have it deal no damage to defending player this turn. If you do so, defending player must play with his or her hand face up on the table until Stromgald Spy leaves play.

cards.name: Swamp Mosquito
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Swamp Mosquito attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

rulings.text: Triggers immediately after blocking is declared if at that time no blockers are assigned to it.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If Swamp Mosquito attacks and is not blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. If a player has ten or more poison counters, he or she loses the game.

cards.text:
Counter target spell. Its controller may draw up to two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: The controller of the countered spell doesn't choose how many cards to draw until the relevant ability resolves. The player may draw 0, 1, or 2 cards. They choose the number before drawing any cards.

Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

Enchant creature

cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked unless defending player pays {3} for each creature they control that's blocking it.
cards.flavor:

—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

rulings.text: In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature cannot be blocked unless defending player pays an additional {3} for each creature assigned to block enchanted creature.

cards.name: Benthic Explorers
cards.text: {T}, Untap a tapped land an opponent controls: Add one mana of any type that land could produce.
cards.flavor: Distant Atlantis charged these Explorers with the task of venturing into unknown waters to track the despised Viscerids.

rulings.text: This ability is not targeted any more.
Untapping a tapped land an opponent controls is part of the cost of Benthic Explorers's ability. If no opponent controls a tapped land, the ability can't be activated.
The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.

Benthic Explorers checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of the land untapped to pay its cost, but it doesn't check the costs of those abilities. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color." If you untap a tapped Vivid Crag an opponent controls while paying for Benthic Explorers's ability, you can add one mana of any color to your mana pool. It doesn't matter whether that Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it.

When determining what types of mana an opponent's land could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to that land's mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.

Benthic Explorers doesn't care about any restrictions or riders an opponent's land (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) puts on the mana it produces. It just cares about types of mana.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target tapped land an opponent controls to add one mana of any type that land produces to your mana pool.

cards.name: Benthic Explorers
cards.text: {T}, Untap a tapped land an opponent controls: Add one mana of any type that land could produce.
cards.flavor: The rising oceans brought new lakes—and new terrors—to Terisiare. The Explorers found their ancient enemies spawning everywhere.

rulings.text: This ability is not targeted any more.

When determining what types of mana an opponent's land could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to that land's mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.

Benthic Explorers doesn't care about any restrictions or riders an opponent's land (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) puts on the mana it produces. It just cares about types of mana.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target tapped land an opponent controls to add one mana of any type that land produces to your mana pool.

cards.name: Browse
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, and exile the rest.
cards.flavor:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
cards.originalText: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library and put one of them into your hand. Remove the remaining four from the game.

cards.name: Diminishing Returns
cards.text: Each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library. You exile the top ten cards of your library. Then each player draws up to seven cards.

rulings.text: Each player chooses to draw any number of cards from zero to seven. First the player whose turn it is chooses how many cards to draw, then draws those cards, then each other player in turn order does the same.
Diminishing Returns won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.
The exiled cards are exiled face up. You'll see them before you choose how many cards to draw.

cards.originalText: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. Remove the top ten cards of your library from the game. Each player draws up to seven cards.

cards.name: False Demise
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"Fool Never believe they're dead until you see the body"
—General Varchild
cards.originalText: If enchanted creature is put into the graveyard, return that creature to play under your control as though it were just cast.

cards.name: False Demise
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"Far too many of our missing 'dead' seem to be turning up in Varchild's ranks"
—King Darien of Kjeldor
cards.originalText: If enchanted creature is put into the graveyard, return that creature to play under your control as though it were just cast.

cards.name: Force of Will
cards.text:
You may pay 1 life and exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

rulings.text: If another effect causes Force of Will to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

cards.originalText:
You may pay 1 life and remove a blue card in your hand from the game instead of paying Force of Will's casting cost. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.
Counter target spell.

cards.name: Foresight
cards.text:
Search your library for three cards, exile them, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.originalText:
Search your library for any three cards and remove them from the game. Shuffle your library afterwards.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Foresight
cards.text:
Search your library for three cards, exile them, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.originalText:
Search your library for any three cards and remove them from the game. Shuffle your library afterwards.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
cards.text: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor: "Lat-Nam has bequeathed us its secrets. With them we shall attain true enlightenment." —Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

rulings.text: Shuffling a card from your hand into your library is mandatory. The effect says "if you do" because performing that action might have been impossible. If you fail to shuffle a card into your library because your hand was empty, you won't draw any cards.

cards.originalText: Choose a card from your hand and shuffle that card into your library to draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
cards.text: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor: "All the knowledge of Lat-Nam could not protect its sages from the Brothers' War." —Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

rulings.text: Shuffling a card from your hand into your library is mandatory. The effect says "if you do" because performing that action might have been impossible. If you fail to shuffle a card into your library because your hand was empty, you won't draw any cards.

cards.originalText: Choose a card from your hand and shuffle that card into your library to draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Library of Lat-Nam
cards.text:
An opponent chooses one —
• You draw three cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
• You search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Target opponent chooses one: you draw three cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep; or you search your library for a card, put it into your hand, and then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Phantasmal Sphere
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Phantasmal Sphere, then sacrifice Phantasmal Sphere unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.
When Phantasmal Sphere leaves the battlefield, target opponent creates an X/X blue Orb creature token with flying, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on Phantasmal Sphere.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Phantasmal Sphere. During your upkeep, pay {1} for each of these +1/+1 counters or bury Phantasmal Sphere.
If Phantasmal Sphere leaves play, put an Orb token into play under target opponent's control. Treat this token as a */* blue creature with flying, where * is equal to the number of these +1/+1 counters on Phantasmal Sphere.

cards.name: Soldevi Heretic
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Target opponent may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"It cannot be Soldev crushed, and my machines to blame?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Prevent up to 2 damage to any creature. Target opponent may draw a card.

cards.name: Soldevi Heretic
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Target opponent may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"In the arms of tragedy, there is little comfort in being right."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Prevent up to 2 damage to any creature. Target opponent may draw a card.

cards.name: Soldevi Sage
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.
cards.flavor:
"Our underground archives grow daily, as our excavators and sages alike dig to uncover hidden wonders."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice two lands to draw three cards. Choose and discard one of those cards.

cards.name: Soldevi Sage
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.
cards.flavor:
"To hide the truth is more than folly—it is fatal."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice two lands to draw three cards. Choose and discard one of those cards.

cards.name: Spiny Starfish
cards.text:
{U}: Regenerate Spiny Starfish.
At the beginning of each end step, if Spiny Starfish regenerated this turn, create a 0/1 blue Starfish creature token for each time it regenerated this turn.

rulings.text: Spiny Starfish's first ability creates a regeneration shield for it. Spiny Starfish's second ability checks whether it _used_ any regeneration shields that turn, not whether any regeneration shields were created for it.

The second ability doesn't care where the regeneration shields Spiny Starfish used that turn came from. If it regenerated due to a regeneration shield from Refresh, for example, the ability will still put a Starfish token onto the battlefield.

The second ability has an "intervening 'if' clause," so it won't trigger at all unless Spiny Starfish had regenerated that turn. However, the number of tokens that are created isn't determined until the ability resolves (in case it regenerates again before that time).
If Spiny Starfish regenerates during the end step after its second ability has resolved, no tokens will be created as a result.

cards.originalText:
{U}: Regenerate
At the end of any turn in which Spiny Starfish regenerated, put a Starfish token into play for each time it regenerated that turn. Treat these tokens as 0/1 blue creatures.

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
"It tells you that the worst is coming. Do you listen?
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
"Watch for it Right on its tailfeathers will be a storm from your nightmares."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Storm Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: Tap target creature with flying.
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: If the exiled card is a snow land, Storm Elemental gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Even though the two activated abilities have the same cost, they're separate. You choose which one you're activating before you exile the top card of your library (and see what it is).
If you activate Storm Elemental's third ability and the exiled card is not a snow land, the ability has no effect.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}: Remove the top card of your library from the game to tap target creature with flying.
{U}: Remove the top card of your library from the game. If that card is a snow-covered land, Storm Elemental gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Suffocation
cards.text:
Cast this spell only if you were dealt damage this turn by a red instant or sorcery spell.
Suffocation deals 4 damage to the controller of the last red instant or sorcery spell that dealt damage to you this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: It means "red instant or red sorcery" not "red instant or any sorcery".

cards.originalText:
Play only when a red sorcery or instant deals damage to you. Suffocation deals 4 damage to that spell's caster.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Thought Lash
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep—Exile the top card of your library. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When a player doesn't pay Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep, that player exiles all cards from their library.
Exile the top card of your library: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

rulings.text: If you don't pay Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep, you'll sacrifice Thought Lash as normal, then, when its triggered ability resolves, you'll exile all cards in your library.
If your library has no cards in it, you can't activate the last ability.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative Upkeep: Remove the top card of your library from the game. If you do not, remove your library from the game and bury Thought Lash.
{0}: Remove the top card of your library from the game to prevent 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Tidal Control
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Pay 2 life or {2}: Counter target red or green spell. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.originalText:
Cumulative Upkeep: {2}
Any player may pay {2} or 2 life to counter target red or green spell. Play this ability as an interrupt. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Viscerid Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to its owner's hand.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to owner's hand.

Enchant creature

{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to its owner's hand.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to owner's hand.

cards.name: Viscerid Drone
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a Swamp: Destroy target nonartifact creature. It can't be regenerated.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a snow Swamp: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Not all of Terisiare's flooding was natural . . . .
cards.originalText:
{T}: Sacrifice a creature and a swamp to bury target non-artifact creature.
{T}: Sacrifice a creature and a snow-covered swamp to bury target creature.

cards.name: Bounty of the Hunt
cards.text:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures. For each +1/+1 counter you put on a creature this way, remove a +1/+1 counter from that creature at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
cards.originalText:
You may remove a green card in your hand from the game instead of paying Bounty of the Hunt's casting cost.
Put three +1/+1 counters, distributed any way you choose, on any number of target creatures. Remove these counters at end of turn.

cards.name: Deadly Insect
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

—Taaveti of Kelsinko,
Elvish Hunter

cards.name: Deadly Insect
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Elvish Bard
cards.text: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so. If this forces a creature to block more attackers than allowed, defending player assigns that creature to block as many of those attackers as allowed.

cards.name: Elvish Ranger
cards.flavor:
"How can any Human hope to match our skills? We are children of Fyndhorn, and its sap runs in our veins."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko,
Elvish Hunter

cards.name: Elvish Ranger
cards.flavor:
"No one may fault an Elvish Ranger's heart, but the simplest frailty may fell even the proudest warrior."

cards.name: Elvish Spirit Guide
cards.text: Exile Elvish Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
"We are never without guidance, if we but seek it."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

rulings.text: This ability is a mana ability.

cards.originalText: If Elvish Spirit Guide is in your hand, you may remove it from the game to add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Fyndhorn Druid
cards.text: When Fyndhorn Druid dies, if it was blocked this turn, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"Honor those who honor Fyndhorn above themselves."
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid
cards.originalText: If Fyndhorn Druid is put into the graveyard the same turn it was blocked, gain 4 life.

cards.name: Fyndhorn Druid
cards.text: When Fyndhorn Druid dies, if it was blocked this turn, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"All struggles ultimately require sacrifice. It's just that some sacrifices are dearer than others."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion,
Juniper Order Advocate
cards.originalText: If Fyndhorn Druid is put into the graveyard the same turn it was blocked, gain 4 life.

cards.name: Gargantuan Gorilla
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a Forest. If you sacrifice a snow Forest this way, Gargantuan Gorilla gains trample until end of turn. If you don't sacrifice a Forest, sacrifice Gargantuan Gorilla and it deals 7 damage to you.
{T}: Gargantuan Gorilla deals damage equal to its power to another target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Gargantuan Gorilla.

rulings.text: Giving either creature first strike does not affect the ability.

If this leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature. On the other hand, if the targeted creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability won't resolve and no damage will be dealt.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, sacrifice a forest, or bury Gargantuan Gorilla and Gargantuan Gorilla deals 7 damage to you. If you sacrifice a snow-covered forest in this way, Gargantuan Gorilla gains trample until end of turn.
{T}: Gargantuan Gorilla deals an amount of damage equal to its power to any other target creature. That creature deals an amount of damage equal to its power to Gargantuan Gorilla.

cards.name: Gift of the Woods
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn and you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: If enchanted creature blocks or is blocked by any creatures, enchanted creature gets +0/+3 until end of turn and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Gift of the Woods

Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn and you gain 1 life.

Trample, rampage: 2
Cannot be blocked by fewer than three creatures.

cards.name: Kaysa
cards.text: Green creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Kaysa speaks as the Elder Druid, but the Yavimaya recognizes only one voice: its own.

rulings.text: Kaysa's ability affects itself.

cards.originalText: All green creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Nature's Chosen
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
Tap enchanted creature: Untap target artifact, creature, or land. Activate this ability only if enchanted creature is white and is untapped and only once each turn.

rulings.text: It is put into the graveyard if you lose control of the creature.

cards.originalText:
Play on a creature you control.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Use this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
{0}: Tap enchanted creature to untap target artifact, creature, or land. Use this ability only if enchanted creature is white and only once each turn.

cards.name: Nature's Wrath
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nature's Wrath unless you pay {G}.
Whenever a player puts an Island or blue permanent onto the battlefield, that player sacrifices an Island or blue permanent.
Whenever a player puts a Swamp or black permanent onto the battlefield, that player sacrifices a Swamp or black permanent.

rulings.text: A single permanent may cause both the second and third abilities to trigger. For example, Underground Sea is both an Island and a Swamp, and Skeleton Ship is both blue and black.
Nature's Wrath cares about who puts the permanent onto the battlefield, not under whose control the permanent enters the battlefield under.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, pay {G} or bury Nature's Wrath.
Whenever a player puts a swamp or black permanent into play, he or she sacrifices a swamp or black permanent.
Whenever a player puts an island or a blue permanent into play, he or she sacrifices an island or blue permanent.

cards.name: Splintering Wind
cards.text: {2}{G}: Splintering Wind deals 1 damage to target creature. Create a 1/1 green Splinter creature token. It has flying and "Cumulative upkeep {G}." When it leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to you and each creature you control. (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless they pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
cards.originalText: {2}{G}: Splintering Wind deals 1 damage to target creature. Put a Splinter token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 green creature with flying and Cumulative Upkeep: {G}.If this token leaves play, it deals 1 damage to you and to each creature you control.

You gain 3 life plus an additional 3 life for each additional {1}{G} you paid.

cards.originalText:
Gain 3 life.
Gain 3 life for each {1}{G} you pay in addition to the casting cost.

cards.name: Taste of Paradise

As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may pay {1}{G} any number of times.
You gain 3 life plus an additional 3 life for each additional {1}{G} you paid.

cards.originalText:
Gain 3 life.
Gain 3 life for each {1}{G} you pay in addition to the casting cost.

cards.name: Tornado
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{2}{G}, Pay 3 life for each velocity counter on Tornado: Destroy target permanent and put a velocity counter on Tornado. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
Cumulative Upkeep: {G}
{2}{G}: Pay 3 life for each velocity counter on Tornado. Destroy target permanent and put a velocity counter on Tornado. Use this ability only once each turn. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Undergrowth
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may pay {2}{R}.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. If this spell's additional cost was paid, this effect doesn't affect combat damage that would be dealt by red creatures.
cards.flavor: "It is the work of sorcery. Burn it!" —Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

rulings.text: It means that red creatures still deal damage if you pay the additional cost.

cards.originalText: No creatures deal damage in combat this turn. If you pay {2}{R} in addition to the casting cost, Undergrowth does not affect red creatures.
